concept.display: How many years have you lived at your current address?
Not including yourself, how many other people live at home with you?
In a group home, nursing home, or other residential facility
Hospital, rehabilitation center, drug treatment center, or other temporary institution
Anywhere outside (e.g., street, vehicle, abandoned building)
In the past 6 months, have you been worried or concerned about NOT having stable housing that you own, rent, or stay in as part of a household?
Think of other people who live with you. How many are under the age of 18 years?
Have you ever served on active duty in the United States Armed forces, either in the regular military or in a National Guard or military reserve unit?

The PMI will contact you periodically to gather additional health related information. In case we cannot contact you, please provide the names, addresses, and telephone numbers of 2 relatives or friends who would know where you could be reached in case we have trouble reaching you. (Please give us the names of persons not currently living in the household).
What is this second person's full name?
What is this second person's telephone number, beginning with the area code?
What is this second person's relationship to you?
What is this second person's mailing address?
What is this second person's email address?
Asian (For example: Asian Indian, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Vietnamese, etc.) *
American Indian or Alaska Native (For example: Aztec, Blackfeet Tribe, Mayan, Navajo Nation, Native Village of Barrow Inupiat Traditional Government, Nome Eskimo Community, etc.)*
Hispanic, Latino, or Spanish (For example: Columbian, Cuban, Dominican, Mexican or Mexican American, Puerto Rican, Salvadoran, etc.) *
White (For example: English, European, French, German, Irish, Italian, Polish, etc.) *
None of these fully describe me (optional free text answer)
Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander (For example: Chamorro, Fijian, Marshallese, Native Hawaiian, Tongan, etc.) *
Black, African American, or African (For example: African American, Ethiopian, Haitian, Jamaican, Nigerian, Somali, etc.) *
Middle Eastern or North African (For example: Algerian, Egyptian, Iranian, Lebanese, Moroccan, Syrian, etc.) *
Which categories describe you? Select all that apply. Note, you may select more than one group.
College 1-3 Years (Some college or technical school)
What is the highest grade or year of school you completed?
What is your current marital status?
Another Number to be Reached at?
What is your annual household income from all sources?
Single service plan (e.g., dental, vision,  prescriptions)

What kind of health insurance or health care coverage do you have? Include those that pay for only one type of service (nursing home care, accidents, or dental care). Exclude private plans that only provide extra cash while hospitalized. If you have more than one kind of health insurance, mark all plans that you have.
Are you covered by health insurance or some other kind of health care plan?
Straight; that is, not gay or lesbian
Which of the following best represents how you think of yourself?
In what country were you born?
None of these describe me, and I want to specify (optional free text)
Questioning or unsure of your gender identity
Do not use labels to identity yourself
Do not think of yourself as having sexuality
Mostly straight, but sometimes attracted to people of your own sex
No, I mean something else (optional free text)
Have not figured out or are in the process of figuring our your sexuality
Are any of these a closer description of how you think of yourself?
Are any of these a closer description to your gender identity?
None of these describe me, and Id like to consider additional options (include jump)
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity?
What was your biological sex assigned at birth?
Do you own or rent your home?
What is your work street address?
Out of work for less than 1 year
Out of work for 1 year or more
What is your current employment status?   Please select 1 or more of these categories.
In the past 7 days, how would you rate your pain on average?
In general, would you say your quality of life is:
How often do you have problems learning about your medical condition because of difficulty understanding written information?
Yes, but don’t know whether one or both ovaries
Yes, but only one ovary or part of one ovary
Have you ever had an ovary removed?
In the past 7 days, how would you rate your fatigue on average?
In general, how would you rate your mental health, including your mood and your ability to think?
Surgery (a hysterectomy to remove your uterus and/or an oophorectomy to remove your ovaries)
In general, would you say your health is:
In general, how would you rate your physical health?
It is difficult for me to find effective solutions to the health problems that come my way.
Have you ever had a hysterectomy (that is, surgery to remove your uterus or womb)?
If yes,   Describe type (for example, bone marrow transplant, kidney, liver, heart, lung, etc.)
Have you had a transplant of any type?
How confident are you filling out medical forms by yourself?
In general, how would you rate your satisfaction with your social activities and relationships?
If Yes to hysterectomy, age at surgery?
In the past 7 days, how often have you been bothered by emotional problems such as feeling anxious, depressed or irritable?
If Yes to ovary removal, age at surgery?

In general, please rate how well you carry out your usual social roles.  (This includes activities at home, at work and in your community, and responsibilities as a parent, child, spouse, employee, friend, etc.)
To what extent are you able to carry out your everyday physical activities such as walking, climbing stairs, carrying groceries, or moving a chair?
How often do you have someone help you read health-related materials?
Yes, I have no menstrual periods
Yes, but I have periods induced by hormones
Have your menstrual periods stopped permanently?
Have you traveled outside of the United States within the past 6 months?
Have you ever used smokeless tobacco products, even one or two times?  (Smokeless tobacco products include snus pouches, Skoal Bandits, loose snus, moist snuff, dip, spit, and chewing tobacco.)
Do you now use smokeless tobacco products…
How old were you when you first started regular cigarette smoking every day?

Have you ever used an electronic nicotine product, even one or two times?  (Electronic nicotine products include e-cigarettes, vape pens, hookah pens, personal vaporizers and mods, e-cigars, e-pipes, and e-hookahs.)
Do you now use electronic nicotine products…
If you have completely stopped smoking cigarettes, how old were you when you stopped?
Do you now smoke cigarettes every day, some days, or not at all?
Have you ever smoked tobacco in a hookah, even one or two puffs?
On average, over the entire time that you smoked, how many cigarettes did you smoke each day? (There are 20 cigarettes in a pack.)
Do you now smoke a traditional cigar, cigarillo, or filtered cigar….
Have you ever smoked a traditional cigar, cigarillo, or filtered cigar, even one or two puffs?
In the past, have you ever made a serious attempt to quit smoking? That is, have you stopped smoking for at least one day or longer because you were trying to quit?
How many years have you or did you smoke cigarettes?
On average, how many cigarettes do you smoke per day now? (There are 20 cigarettes in a pack.)
Have you smoked at least 100 cigarettes in your entire life? (There are 20 cigarettes in a pack.)
Four or more times a week
Two to three times a week
Two to four times a month
How often did you have a drink containing alcohol in the past year?

In your entire life, have you had at least 1 drink of any kind of alcohol, not counting small tastes or sips? (By a “drink,” we mean a can or bottle of beer, a glass of wine or a wine cooler, a shot of liquor, or a mixed drink with liquor in it.)
How many drinks did you have on a typical day when you were drinking in the past year?
How often did you have six or more drinks on one occasion in the past year?
g. Hallucinogens (LSD, acid, mushrooms, PCP, Special K, ecstasy, etc.)
d. Methamphetamine (speed, crystal meth, ice, etc.)
f. Sedatives or sleeping pills for non-medical reasons (Valium, Serepax, Ativan, Xanax, Librium, Rohypnol, GHB, etc.)
a. Marijuana (cannabis, pot, grass, hash, weed, etc.)
i. Prescription opioids for non-medical reasons (fentanyl, oxycodone [OxyContin, Percocet], hydrocodone [Vicodin], methadone, buprenorphine, etc.)
e. Inhalants (nitrous oxide, glue, gas, paint thinner, etc.)
c. Prescription stimulants for non-medical reasons (Ritalin, Concerta, Dexedrine, Adderall, diet pills, etc.)
In your LIFETIME, which of the following substances have you ever used?
a. Marijuana (cannabis, pot, grass, hash, weed, etc.)
i. Prescription opioids for non-medical reasons (obana, fentanyl, oxycodone [OxyContin, Percocet], hydrocodone [Vicodin], methadone, buprenorphine [Supoxone], etc.)
c. Prescription stimulants for non-medical reasons (Vyvanse, Ritalin, Concerta, Dexedrine, Adderall, diet pills, etc.)
g. Hallucinogens (LSD, acid, mushrooms, PCP, Special K, ecstasy, etc.)
e. Inhalants (nitrous oxide, glue, gas, paint thinner, etc.)
d. Other stimulants (methamphetamine (speed, crystal meth, ice, etc.), k2/spice, bath salts)
f. Sedatives or sleeping pills for non-medical reasons (Valium, Serepax, Ativan, Xanax, Librium, Rohypnol, GHB, etc.)
In the past three months, how often have you used the substances you mentioned (first drug, second drug, etc)?

resource.name: values-for-RecreationalDrugUse_Past3MonthUseFrequency
resource.title: Values for In the past three months, how often have you used the substances you mentioned (first drug, second drug, etc)?
resource.publisher: Precision Medicine Initiative: All of Us Resarch Program

concept.display: a. Marijuana (cannabis, pot, grass, hash, weed, etc.)
i. Prescription opioids for non-medical reasons (obana, fentanyl, oxycodone [OxyContin, Percocet], hydrocodone [Vicodin], methadone, buprenorphine [Supoxone], etc.)
c. Prescription stimulants for non-medical reasons (Vyvanse, Ritalin, Concerta, Dexedrine, Adderall, diet pills, etc.)
g. Hallucinogens (LSD, acid, mushrooms, PCP, Special K, ecstasy, etc.)
e. Inhalants (nitrous oxide, glue, gas, paint thinner, etc.)
d. Other stimulants (methamphetamine (speed, crystal meth, ice, etc.), k2/spice, bath salts)
f. Sedatives or sleeping pills for non-medical reasons (Valium, Serepax, Ativan, Xanax, Librium, Rohypnol, GHB, etc.)

resource.name: values-for-Smoking_100CigsLifetime
resource.title: Values for Have you smoked at least 100 cigarettes in your entire life? (There are 20 cigarettes in a pack.)
resource.publisher: Precision Medicine Initiative: All of Us Resarch Program
